sentences.en: A mouse ran out from the dark orifice of the cave.
sentences.cn: 一只老鼠从黑暗的洞口跑出.

sentences.en: A winding path leads to the cave.
sentences.cn: 一条曲折的小道通向山洞.

sentences.en: Both boats purred out of the cave mouth and into open water.
sentences.cn: 两艘船隆隆地从洞口开出，进入了开阔的水域。

sentences.en: But in some respects cave dwellers were far cleverer than us.
sentences.cn: 但是在某些方面穴居人要比我们聪明得多。

sentences.en: Len's club would have caved his skull in.
sentences.cn: 伦的棍子就已经把他脑袋打陷下去了。

sentences.en: Most of the mouth of the cave was submerged in the lake.
sentences.cn: 洞口大半都淹没在湖里。

sentences.en: The cave was echoing with shouts.
the dusky light inside the cave
The entrance to the cave was infilled by the landowner.
sentences.cn: 山洞的入口被地产的主人给堵上了。

sentences.en: The force of the water washed him back into the cave.
The roof of the cave dropped in on the miners, trapping them.
sentences.cn: 洞穴的顶部坍了下来, 砸在矿工身上.

sentences.en: The thieves hid their plunder in the cave.
There is only a pinpoint of light in the cave.
sentences.cn: 山洞中只能见到一丝光线.

sentences.en: There is water in the interior of the cave.
They tried digging in a patch just below the cave.
sentences.cn: 他们试着在洞穴正下方的一块地上挖掘。

words.tran_cn: 似巨穴的；洞穴状的；凹状的；瓮声的

phrases.tran_cn: (屋顶等)下陷，坍塌，倒塌；使下陷，使倒塌

trans.tran_en: a large natural hole in the side of a cliff or hill, or under the ground
a large natural hole in the side of a cliff or hill, or under the ground

trans.tran_cn: 使凹陷，使塌落；在…挖洞穴
